unnormalised: Okay folks, let's talk rental yields! Seems dry, but trust me, it's basically *the* key to figuring out if that Mumbai flat you're eyeing is actually a good investment.
normalised: Okay folks, let us talk rental yields! Seems dry, but trust me, it is basically *the* key to figuring out if that Mumbai flat you are eyeing is actually a good investment.

unnormalised: Simply put, rental yield is the return you get on your investment property based on the rent you collect. Higher the yield, the happier your pocket (and your accountant, Rajesh bhai!).
normalised: Simply put, rental yield is the return you get on your investment property based on the rent you collect. Higher the yield, the happier your pocket (and your accountant, Rajesh bhai!).
(Annual Rental Income divided by Property Value) multiplied by one hundred.

unnormalised: So, if you're renting out a flat in Bandra for Rs. 50,000 per month, and the property's value is Rs. 1 Crore, your gross annual rental income is Rs. 6 Lakhs. Your gross rental yield would be (6,00,000/1,00,00,000) * 100 = 6%.
normalised: So, if you are renting out a flat in Bandra for rupees fifty thousand per month, and the property's value is rupees one crore, your gross annual rental income is rupees six lakhs. Your gross rental yield would be (six lakh divided by one crore) multiplied by one hundred equals six percent.

unnormalised: Depends! In cities like Bangalore, you might be happy with 3-4% given the insane property prices. Smaller towns might offer better yields. Consider expenses like property tax (BMC will happily take their cut!), maintenance, and maybe even a little bribe to the local society secretary during Diwali.
normalised: Depends! In cities like Bangalore, you might be happy with three to four percent given the insane property prices. Smaller towns might offer better yields. Consider expenses like property tax (B M C will happily take their cut!), maintenance, and maybe even a little bribe to the local society secretary during Diwali.

unnormalised: Don't just focus on the yield. Think about capital appreciation (will the property value go up?), vacancy rates (will you always have tenants?), and the area. Buying near a good school (like DPS, RK Puram) usually guarantees consistent demand.
normalised: Don't just focus on the yield. Think about capital appreciation (will the property value go up?), vacancy rates (will you always have tenants?), and the area. Buying near a good school (like D P S, R K Puram) usually guarantees consistent demand.

unnormalised: Think long term! It’s like slow cooking a good biryani – patience and the right ingredients (property) will give you a delicious (profitable) outcome. Good luck, and happy investing this Onam!
